title: Lina Khan Sees Turbulent Start as Head of Federal Trade Commission
sub_head: Criticized by Republicans, Khan tells agency staffers she aims to build bridges going forward
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Lina Khan, the new Federal Trade Commission chairwoman with broad ambitions to take on big business, has faced early turbulence within the agency, including from career staffers she will need to build antitrust cases and write regulations.
President Biden tapped the 32-year-old Ms. Khan in June to lead the five-member FTC. She aims to challenge more corporate mergers and allegedly monopolistic practices, as well as adopt regulations to head off what she sees as unfair business tactics.
